eu.stratosphere.nephele.services.memorymanager

Class MemorySegment

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.stratosphere.nephele.services.memorymanager.MemorySegment

  • public class MemorySegment
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a piece of memory allocated from the memory manager. The segment is backed by a byte array and features random put and get methods for the basic types that are stored in a byte-wise fashion in the memory.
    Author:
    Alexander Alexandrov, Stephan Ewen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MemorySegment(byte[] memory, int offset, int size)
      Creates a new memory segment of given size with the provided views.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MemorySegment

        public MemorySegment(byte[] memory,
                     int offset,
                     int size)
        Creates a new memory segment of given size with the provided views.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the memory segment.
        inputView - The input view to use.
        outputView - The output view to use.

    • Method Detail

      • isFreed

        public boolean isFreed()
        Checks whether this memory segment has already been freed. In that case, the segment must not be used any more.
        Returns:
        True, if the segment has been freed, false otherwise.

      • size

        public final int size()
        Gets the size of the memory segment, in bytes. Because segments are backed by arrays, they cannot be larger than two GiBytes.
        Returns:
        The size in bytes.

      • getBackingArray

        public final byte[] getBackingArray()
        Gets the byte array that backs the memory segment and this random access view. Since different regions of the backing array are used by different segments, the logical positions in this view do not correspond to the indexes in the backing array and need to be translated via the translateOffset(int) method.
        Returns:
        The backing byte array.

      • translateOffset

        public final int translateOffset(int offset)
        Translates the given offset for this view into the offset for the backing array.
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset to be translated.
        Returns:
        The corresponding position in the backing array.

      • wrap

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer wrap(int offset,
                                int length)
        Wraps the chunk of the underlying memory located between offset and length in a NIO ByteBuffer.
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset in the memory segment.
        length - The number of bytes to be wrapped as a buffer.
        Returns:
        A ByteBuffer backed by the specified portion of the memory segment.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown, if offset is negative or larger than the memory segment size, or if the offset plus the length is larger than the segment size.

      • get

        public final byte get(int index)
        Reads the byte at the given position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position from which the byte will be read
        Returns:
        The byte at the given position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown, if the index is negative, or larger or equal to the size of the memory segment.

      • put

        public final MemorySegment put(int index,
                               byte b)
        Writes the given byte into this buffer at the given position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position at which the byte will be written.
        b - The byte value to be written.
        Returns:
        This view itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown, if the index is negative, or larger or equal to the size of the memory segment.

      • get

        public final MemorySegment get(int index,
                               byte[] dst)
        Bulk get method. Copies dst.length memory from the specified position to the destination memory.
        Parameters:
        position - The position at which the first byte will be read.
        dst - The memory into which the memory will be copied.
        Returns:
        This view itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown, if the index is negative, or too large that the data between the index and the memory segment end is not enough to fill the destination array.

      • put

        public final MemorySegment put(int index,
                               byte[] src)
        Bulk put method. Copies src.length memory from the source memory into the memory segment beginning at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        index - The position in the memory segment array, where the data is put.
        src - The source array to copy the data from.
        Returns:
        This random access view itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown, if the index is negative, or too large such that the array size exceed the amount of memory between the index and the memory segment's end.

      • get

        public final MemorySegment get(int index,
                               byte[] dst,
                               int offset,
                               int length)
        Bulk get method. Copies length memory from the specified position to the destination memory, beginning at the given offset
        Parameters:
        position - The position at which the first byte will be read.
        dst - The memory into which the memory will be copied.
        offset - The copying offset in the destination memory.
        length - The number of bytes to be copied.
        Returns:
        This view itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown, if the index is negative, or too large that the requested number of bytes exceed the amount of memory between the index and the memory segment's end.

      • put

        public final MemorySegment put(int index,
                               byte[] src,
                               int offset,
                               int length)
        Bulk put method. Copies length memory starting at position offset from the source memory into the memory segment starting at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The position in the memory segment array, where the data is put.
        src - The source array to copy the data from.
        offset - The offset in the source array where the copying is started.
        length - The number of bytes to copy.
        Returns:
        This random access view itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown, if the index is negative, or too large such that the array portion to copy exceed the amount of memory between the index and the memory segment's end.

      • get

        public final MemorySegment get(java.io.DataOutput out,
                               int offset,
                               int length)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Bulk get method. Copies length memory from the specified offset to the provided DataOutput.
        Parameters:
        out - The data output object to copy the data to.
        offset - The first byte to by copied.
        length - The number of bytes to copy.
        Returns:
        This view itself.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the DataOutput encountered a problem upon writing.

      • put

        public final MemorySegment put(java.io.DataInput in,
                               int offset,
                               int length)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Bulk put method. Copies length memory from the given DataInput to the memory starting at position offset.
        Parameters:
        in - The DataInput to get the data from.
        offset - The position in the memory segment to copy the chunk to.
        length - The number of bytes to get.
        Returns:
        This random access view itself.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the DataInput encountered a problem upon reading, such as an End-Of-File.

      • getBoolean

        public final boolean getBoolean(int index)
        Reads one byte at the given position and returns its boolean representation.
        Parameters:
        position - The position from which the memory will be read.
        Returns:
        The char value at the given position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown, if the index is negative, or larger then the segment size minus 1.

      • putBoolean

        public final MemorySegment putBoolean(int index,
                                      boolean value)
        Writes one byte containing the byte value into this buffer at the given position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position at which the memory will be written.
        value - The char value to be written.
        Returns:
        This view itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown, if the index is negative, or larger then the segment size minus 1.

      • getChar

        public final char getChar(int index)
        Reads two memory at the given position, composing them into a char value according to the current byte order.
        Parameters:
        position - The position from which the memory will be read.
        Returns:
        The char value at the given position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown, if the index is negative, or larger then the segment size minus 2.

      • putChar

        public final MemorySegment putChar(int index,
                                   char value)
        Writes two memory containing the given char value, in the current byte order, into this buffer at the given position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position at which the memory will be written.
        value - The char value to be written.
        Returns:
        This view itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown, if the index is negative, or larger then the segment size minus 2.
